hero.description: An affordable, comfortable, wireless, 360Â° solution for full-body tracking in virtual reality

vr.title: VR Games
vr.desc: SlimeVR Trackers are compatible with any SteamVR games that suport full body tracking. That includes social games like VRChat or Neos

vtubing.title: VTubing
vtubing.desc: SlimeVR Trackers also work with VMC. No VR headset required!

motion-capture.title: Motion Capture
motion-capture.desc: SlimeVR can be used to export Motion Capture data via the BVH file format. This allows for your tracking data to be imported inside 3d rendering software like Blende

question-1.question: How Does SlimeVR Work?
question-1.answer: Each SlimeVR Tracker track its own absolute rotation using an IMU (Inertial Measurement Unit). It sends the data to SlimeVR Server running on your PC via Wi-Fi connection, where SlimeVR Server combines the data from multiple trackers on your body and your body proportions to calculate position of your body using your Headset as a reference point.

question-2.question: Does SlimeVR Require Base Stations?
question-2.answer: SlimeVR Trackers don't require base stations or other outside tracking systems.

question-3.question: Does SlimeVR Needs Cameras?
question-3.answer: SlimeVR Trackers don't need and don't use cameras.

question-4.question: Can SlimeVR Be Occluded?
question-4.answer: No! SlimeVR Trackers track their own rotation, so they can't be blocked or occluded by clothes, body, blankets, walls or anything else.

question-5.question: What Is IMU Tracker Drift?
question-5.answer: Due to the nature of IMU trackers they are susceptible to something called yaw drift.\nThis is not the same as controller stick drift. IMU yaw drift is caused by very minor tracking imperfections that add up overtime and cause a tracker to think it has rotated further than it actually is.\nThis takes some time to occur and can be very easily resolved with a reset!

question-6.question: How Do I Reset IMU Tracker Drift?
question-6.answer: For SlimeVR reset is very simple: just take a reset pose (by default, standing up or I-pose), and tap your chest tracker two times. You can configure other ways to reset, like key- or controller-bind or other taps.

question-7.question: How Do I Calibrate SlimeVR?
question-7.answer: Please follow the handy Calibration Guide or instructions in the server.

question-8.question: How Do I Set Up SlimeVR?
question-8.answer: Please follow the Setup Guide or instructions in the server.

question-9.question: Which Games SlimeVR Work With?
question-9.answer: SlimeVR Trackers work with any VR game that supports Full-Body Tracking, including but not limited to **VRChat**, **NeosVR**, **Blade And Sorcery**, **Dance Dash**, **Zenith: Nexus**, **Chillout VR**, **Resonite**, **LIV** and many others! Any game that supports FBT via SteamVR, OSC or VMC are compatible with SlimeVR Trackers!

question-10.question: Which Headsets SlimeVR is Compatible With?
question-10.answer: SlimeVR Trackers work with any modern VR and XR headset that can work with SteamVR, as well as many standalone headsets, including but not limited to Valve Index, Meta Quest 1, 2, 3, Pro and others (aka Oculus Quest 1, 2, 3, Pro), Oculus Quest, HTC Vive, Vive Pro, Vajro, Bigscreen Byond, Pico 3, Pico 4, and many-many others!

question-11.question: Which vTubing Software SlimeVR is Compatible With?
question-11.answer: SlimeVR Trackers are compatible with any vTubing software that can work with OSC or VMC protocols or compatible with SteamVR, which are most of them, including VSeeFace, Warudo, Tracking Worlds and many more!

question-12.question: Which Motion Capture Software SlimeVR is Compatible With?
question-12.answer: SlimeVR Trackers are compatible with Motion Capture (MoCap) software that can work with OSC or VMC protocols, or with SteamVR, or that can import BVH files, including Blender, Unreal Engine and others.

question-14.question: How Long SlimeVR Tracker's Battery Lasts?
question-14.answer: SlimeVR Trackers last 10-15 hours on one full charge.

question-15.question: Which Operating Systems SlimeVR is Compatible With?
question-15.answer: SlimeVR is compatible with Windows 8, 8.1, 10, 11, Linux, MacOS X, Android and iPhone OS.

question-16.question: Can SlimeVR Be Used With Quest 2/3 Standalone?
question-16.answer: Yes, SlimeVR Trackers can be used with Quest 2, Quest 3, PICO 4 and some other standalone headsets without the need for PC.

question-17.question: What's SlimeVR Tracker Extension?
question-17.answer: SlimeVR Tracker Extension is a smaller tracker that connects to a Main Tracker via a wire. It uses Main Tracker's Wi-Fi connection, battery and processing power, so it can be smaller and cheaper than a full tracker, and it also doesn't require charging.

question-18.question: How SlimeVR Connects To a PC?
question-18.answer: SlimeVR Trackers connect to your local network via Wi-Fi and can connect to your PC on the same network. Your PC doesn't need to have a Wi-Fi connection, as long as it's connected to the same network as trackers.

question-19.question: Do I Need Fast Internet For SlimeVR?
question-19.answer: SlimeVR Trackers don't require internet and connect to your PC via local network.

question-20.question: Do I Need Good Wi-Fi For SlimeVR?
question-20.answer: SlimeVR Trackers don't require good Wi-Fi, but if your network is congested or has too many devices, you may experience connection issues or lags, so the experience may vary.

question-21.question: Do I Need Good Wi-Fi For SlimeVR?
question-21.answer: SlimeVR Trackers don't require good Wi-Fi, but if your network is congested or has too many devices, you may experience connection issues or lags, so the experience may vary.

question-22.question: How Many SlimeVR Trackers Do I Need?
question-22.answer: At the very least to track your legs you need 5 SlimeVR Trackers - one for chest, two for thighs, and two for ankles. This will give you hip and ankle tracking (3-point FBT) as well as knee tracking as a bonus.

question-23.question: How Can I Use Additional SlimeVR Trackers?
question-23.answer: You can use additional SlimeVR Trackers to track more body parts, for example, feet, arms or head; or to improve tracking precision by adding a hip tracker.

question-24.question: How Do I Charge SlimeVR Trackers?
question-24.answer: SlimeVR Trackers can be charged with any USB-C charging cable and any compatible USB charger.

question-25.question: Can I Use SlimeVR With ShadowPC or Similar Services?
question-25.answer: Yes. For remote setup please follow [our guides](https://docs.slimevr.dev/tools/shadowpc.html).

question-26.question: Is SlimeVR Open-Source?
question-26.answer: SlimeVR is completely open-source, you can find all of the source code on our [GitHub](https://github.com/slimevr)!

question-27.question: Where Do I Buy SllimeVR Trackers?
question-27.answer: Original SlimeVR Trackers are only sold through our official distributors - Crowd Supply and Mouser Electronics.

question-28.question: Do I Need 2.4Ghz Wi-Fi?
question-28.answer: Yes. SlimeVR Trackers can only connect to 2.4Ghz Wi-Fi 4 networks. Most modern Wi-Fi routers support dual-band operation where you can have both 2.4Ghz and 5Ghz devices on the same network, so you don't need to downgrade your wi-fi for SlimeVR.
